item.title: Mandy add a quote by Emerson, Ralph Waldo
item.description: "I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me." -- Emerson, Ralph Waldo

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Good books are as friends, willing to give to us if we are willing to make a little effort." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Generally speaking, the most miserable people I know are those who are obsessed with themselves; the happiest people I know are those who lose themselves in the service of others...By and large, I have come to see that if we complain about life, it is because we are thinking only of ourselves." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Reading is one of the true pleasures of life. In our age of mass culture, when so much that we encounter is abridged,adapted, adulterated, shredded, and boiled down, it is mind-easing and mind-inspiring to sit down privately with a congenial book..." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Joseph Smith Jr.
item.description: "We say that God is true; that the Constitution of the United States is true; that the Bible is true; and that the Book of Mormon is true, and that Christ is true" -- Joseph Smith Jr.

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Marjorie Pay Hinckley
item.description: "I don't want to drive up to the pearly gates in a shiny sports car, wearing beautifully, tailored clothes, my hair expertly coiffed, and with long, perfectly manicured fingernails. I want to drive up in a station wagon that has mud on the wheels from taking kids to scout camp. I want to be there with a smudge of peanut butter on my shirt from making sandwiches for a sick neighbors children. I want to be there with a little dirt under my fingernails from helping to weed someone's garden. I want to be there with children's sticky kisses on my cheeks and the tears of a friend on my shoulder. I want the Lord to know I was really here and that I really lived." -- Marjorie Pay Hinckley

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Marjorie Pay Hinckley
item.description: "Home is where you are loved the most and act the worst." -- Marjorie Pay Hinckley

item.title: Mandy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world." -- Ray Bradbury
